definition: King Gou Jian of Yue (c. 470 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
to attract/to arouse/to tick/to strike out/to delineate/to collude/variant of 鉤|钩[gou1], hook
surname Gou
see 勾當|勾当[gou4 dang4]
to fulfill (a promise)/to tread/to walk
King Gou Jian of Yue (c. 470 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸

sentences.english: Why choose Gou yield and Revival.
sentences.chinese: 为什么勾践要选择屈服和卧薪尝胆。

sentences.english: This is the story of hardships known Gou same.
sentences.chinese: 这与家喻户晓的勾践卧薪尝胆的典故如出一辙。
勾践从来没有忘记这段耻辱。

sentences.english: Three years later, Gou Jian was set free and returned to the State of Yue.
sentences.chinese: 三年以后，勾践终于被释放回了越国。

sentences.english: Gou Jian got a chance eventually, lift arms answer state.
sentences.chinese: 勾践终于得到了机会，举兵复国。

sentences.english: However, Goujian's story has another reading, too.
sentences.chinese: 但是，勾践的故事还有另一方法解读。

sentences.english: Gou secretly trained his army after he went back to his own state.
sentences.chinese: 回到他自己的国家后，勾践秘密地训练自己的军队。

sentences.english: Many years later, he was set free.
sentences.chinese: 几年以后，勾践被放回越国。

sentences.english: Several years later, he was set free.
sentences.chinese: 几年以后，勾践被放回越国。
